title: Dion & The Belmonts - 24 Original Classics: 1958-1978 (1984)

AMG Bio.txt
AMG Review.txt
info.txt (which is simply these notes included in the torrent)

First biography paragraph from All Music (by Richie Unterberger):

Bridging the era between late-'50s rock and the British Invasion, Dion DiMucci (born July 18, 1939) was one of the top white rock singers of his time, blending the best elements of doo wop, teen idol, and R&B styles. Some revisionists have tried to cast him as a sort of early blue-eyed soul figure, although he was probably more aligned with pop/rock, at first as the lead singer of the Belmonts, and then as a solo star. Drug problems slowed him down in the mid-'60s, yet he made some surprisingly interesting progressions into blues-rock and folk-rock as the decade wore on, culminating in a successful comeback in the late '60s, although he was unable to sustain its commercial and artistic momentum for long.

Read all of the bio at: <a href=" http://www.allmusic.com/artist/dion-p4100/biography" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.allmusic.com/artist/dion-p4100/biography</a>

All Music Album Review (by Stephen Thomas Erlewine):

24 Golden Greats contains all of Dion & the Belmonts' biggest hits, plus all of Dion's solo hits from the late '60s and early '70s, making it the definitive compilation of the vocalist's long, successful career.

Taken from: <a href=" http://www.allmusic.com/album/24-golden-greats-r5846" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.allmusic.com/album/24-golden-greats-r5846</a>

Amazon.com's page: <a href=" http://www.amazon.com/dp/B000CSN9DA" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.amazon.com/dp/B000CSN9DA</a>
